---

## Purpose

**This document is automatically generated by your Writing Team skills.**

You never need to manually track or look up IDs. This reference is provided for transparency and debugging only. Your Writing Team skills handle all ID resolution automatically - you simply work with human-readable names.

---

## How This Works

1. **Skills Automatically Discover and Cache IDs**
   - When you use skills like `series-planning`, `book-planning`, or `character-planning`, they automatically query the MCP system
   - Discovered IDs are cached in memory for the session
   - Skills maintain their own internal ID mappings

2. **Skills Handle All ID Resolution**
   - You never need to look up or specify IDs manually
   - Skills translate human-readable names to IDs behind the scenes
   - ID management is completely automated

3. **You Work With Human-Readable Names Only**
   - Just say "Book 1" or "the protagonist" or "the magic system"
   - Skills figure out the corresponding IDs automatically
   - No need to remember cryptic ID strings

4. **This Document Shows What the Skills Discovered**
   - Provides visibility into what's in the MCP system
   - Useful for debugging if something seems wrong
   - Updated automatically as skills discover new entities

## 5. Characters Registry

> **Generated By**: character-planning skill
>
> Track all characters across the series. Note which book they first appear in.

| Character ID | Character Name | Role | First Appears | Status | Series ID | Notes |
|--------------|----------------|------|---------------|--------|-----------|-------|
| `char_001` | [Name] | Protagonist/Antagonist/Supporting | Book 1 | Active/Deceased/Inactive | `series_001` | [Key traits] |
| `char_002` | [Name] | Protagonist/Antagonist/Supporting | Book 1 | Active/Deceased/Inactive | `series_001` | [Key traits] |
| `char_003` | [Name] | Protagonist/Antagonist/Supporting | Book 2 | Active/Deceased/Inactive | `series_001` | [Key traits] |

**Character Role Definitions:**
- **Protagonist**: Main character(s) driving the story
- **Antagonist**: Primary opposition/villain
- **Supporting**: Recurring secondary characters
- **Minor**: Appear in limited scenes

## 8. Plot Threads Registry

> **Generated By**: plot-tracking skill
>
> Track ongoing plot threads that span multiple chapters or books.

| Thread ID | Thread Name | Type | Status | Introduced | Resolved | Books Spanning | Notes |
|-----------|-------------|------|--------|------------|----------|----------------|-------|
| `thread_001` | [Thread Name] | Series Arc/Book Arc/Subplot | Active/Resolved/Dormant | Book 1, Ch. 1 | [Book/Ch or TBD] | Book 1-3 | [Details] |
| `thread_002` | [Thread Name] | Series Arc/Book Arc/Subplot | Active/Resolved/Dormant | Book 1, Ch. 3 | [Book/Ch or TBD] | Book 1 | [Details] |
| `thread_003` | [Thread Name] | Series Arc/Book Arc/Subplot | Active/Resolved/Dormant | Book 1, Ch. 5 | [Book/Ch or TBD] | Book 1-2 | [Details] |

**Thread Types:**
- **Series Arc**: Spans multiple books
- **Book Arc**: Main plot for a single book
- **Subplot**: Secondary storyline

## 11. Quick MCP Commands Reference

> **Note**: These commands are shown for reference only. Your Writing Team skills execute these automatically.
>
> You never need to run these commands manually. When you ask your Writing Team to perform tasks, they handle all MCP interactions behind the scenes.

### Author Operations
```
mcp get_author(author_id="author_[id]")
mcp update_author(author_id="author_[id]", ...)
```

### Series Operations
```
mcp get_series(series_id="series_[id]")
mcp create_series(author_id="author_[id]", title="...", genre="...")
mcp update_series(series_id="series_[id]", ...)
```

### Book Operations
```
mcp get_book(book_id="book_[id]")
mcp create_book(series_id="series_[id]", title="...", book_number=1)
mcp update_book(book_id="book_[id]", ...)
mcp get_book_outline(book_id="book_[id]")
```

### Character Operations
```
mcp get_character(character_id="char_[id]")
mcp create_character(series_id="series_[id]", name="...", role="...")
mcp update_character(character_id="char_[id]", ...)
mcp list_characters(series_id="series_[id]")
```

### Location Operations
```
mcp get_location(location_id="loc_[id]")
mcp create_location(series_id="series_[id]", name="...", type="...")
mcp update_location(location_id="loc_[id]", ...)
```

### Chapter Operations
```
mcp get_chapter(chapter_id="chapter_[id]")
mcp create_chapter(book_id="book_[id]", chapter_number=1, title="...")
mcp update_chapter(chapter_id="chapter_[id]", ...)
mcp list_chapters(book_id="book_[id]")
```

### Scene Operations
```
mcp get_scene(scene_id="scene_[id]")
mcp create_scene(chapter_id="chapter_[id]", scene_number=1, pov_character_id="char_[id]")
mcp update_scene(scene_id="scene_[id]", ...)
mcp list_scenes(chapter_id="chapter_[id]")
```

### Plot Thread Operations
```
mcp get_plot_thread(thread_id="thread_[id]")
mcp create_plot_thread(book_id="book_[id]", name="...", type="...")
mcp update_plot_thread(thread_id="thread_[id]", ...)
```

### World Building Operations
```
mcp get_world_rule(rule_id="rule_[id]")
mcp create_world_rule(series_id="series_[id]", name="...", category="...")
mcp update_world_rule(rule_id="rule_[id]", ...)
```

## Tips for Understanding This Reference

1. **You Don't Need to Update This**: Skills maintain this automatically
2. **You Don't Need to Look Up IDs**: Skills handle ID resolution for you
3. **Just Use Plain English**: Tell your Writing Team what you want in natural language
4. **This is for Transparency**: See what entities exist in your project
5. **Useful for Debugging**: If something seems wrong, check what IDs exist here
6. **Search Friendly**: Use Ctrl+F / Cmd+F to quickly find characters, locations, etc.
7. **Version Controlled**: This file is tracked in git for historical reference
